lender.name: Kristen, SoulChef
lender.loan_because:
I want to see people fulfill their dreams of business ownership and helping them purchase the items they need means so much to me. I enjoy a relatively fruitful life; loving husband & children, good friends, great experiences, fabulous food (created by me), & more.
I've always volunteered or donated goods, services, or money. But It's time to give back in a bigger way.
Kiva gives me the tools to do that.
Whether my business succeeds in great leaps and bounds or one baby step at a time, I understand the demands & obstacles of attempting the huge feat of self-sufficiency by owning a business.
It's with this understanding & lots of compassion that I make loans with Kiva.
~Kristen
lender.occupational_info:
I am an Ayurvedic/Organic Personal Chef. I specialize in cooking for people suffering from life threatening illnesses.
I believe by using all my gifts, I can do my part in helping humanity; the reason I'm here in the first place. I'm a student of life & love learning, sharing, cooking & of course, helping entrepreneurs get the money they need to succeed.

lender.name: Suresh
lender.loan_because: I am musician of old traditional music of Nepal, i am street musician and selling a fetal in street , is because i don't have enough capital to open a new retail shop in Nepal,
lender.occupational_info:
My occupational back ground
The Gandharba are Nepal’s only traditional musician caste. According to myth, the original Gandharba descended from the heavens to spread local news, music and songs from community to community. In Hindu mythology the Gandharba were once the winged musicians of the Gods. Unfortunately, the Gandharbas belong to a caste that belongs to the "dalit" or “untouchables”- a title given to those born into a role that once left them within the socially and economically downtrodden groups of Nepal. Long before Television and the Radio, they travelled from place to place, playing their lively music and spreading news, making them messengers of the nation. Our ancestors would sing tales with themes ranging from battles and stories of long ago to local gossip, in exchange for a small amount of money or food. We played a significant role in spreading and preserving Nepali culture and folklore. During the unification of Nepal, King Prithivi Narayan Shah utilized the Gandharba people throughout the country to sing in favor of a united kingdom. Gandharbas further played a diplomatic and tactical role in the formation of Nepal as a united kingdom, by facilitating the transfer of information from one region to another, encouraging cooperation between the different districts that were finally uniting. Throughout Nepali History this has been the case, up until the present day, such as seen in the role played by the Gandharbas in the JANA ANDOLAN of 2006/2007.
The recent advances in modern media communication have displaced our traditional roles. Regular employment as a traditional Nepali folk musician is difficult to both find and secure, despite the fact that our music is a cultural treasure. We have little or no land and, due to poverty, many of us have not received an education beyond primary school. In an effort to find musical employment many Gandharbas have migrated to the main tourist areas of Nepal, hoping to sell an occasional Sarangi as a means of inconsistent income. We have our own culture, rituals, traditions and lifestyle, which we strive with the meager funds raised from sale of our musical instruments, or the occasional performances, to maintain in a modern, developing, ever more expensive world.
Relying so heavily on tourism as a source of income, most of the Gandharba living and working in the cities are left homeless and food-less during off-peak tourist seasons. Improved shelter, food, clothing, jobs, health and education are urgently required for this group of people to survive, as well as maintain their identity in this busy world. Still we wander form place to place, trying to make a living. Many of us have migrated from the village to the city with families in toe, looking for employment, better living conditions, and a better quality education for their children. The majority of Gandharbas are illiterate. Job discrimination is common - not a single senior level position in the government is held by a Gadharba. We have been involved in Dalit networks and in several programs involving but we are left out by the Dalit organizatons as well.
According to the census of 2001 AD, the Gandharba population counts approximately 5890. This account, however, is not believed to be accurate but rather an underestimate of the actual number, as it did not take into consideration that Gandharbas are also known by different surnames such as Ranjan, Baikar, Nepali, Gandhari

lender.name: ReveNews

lender.occupational_info: We are a blog focused on online marketing news that has been in existence since 1998.

lender.loan_because: Because we care. And we're a nice class.

lender.name: Chris
lender.loan_because: Charitable giving should be non-compulsory and one must lead by example.

lender.name: Steven
lender.loan_because: even though I am a college student with little money to spare, I have the chance to make a difference with a little bit of money for someone who really needs it.
lender.occupational_info: I am a student studying Elementary/Special/Early Childhood Education at Gwynedd-Mercy College.

lender.name: Michael
lender.loan_because: the practical business ideas of those all over the world are just a micro-loan away from bringing prosperity and happiness to entire families, neighborhoods, and villages.
lender.occupational_info: I aspire to be a school psychologist to ensure that everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed in school and achieve their dreams!

lender.name: Benjamin Z. Noréns
lender.loan_because: Microfinance is an important element for the sustainable empowerment of individuals and communities.
lender.occupational_info: Psychotherapist

lender.name: chris
lender.loan_because: Why not

lender.name: Jake
lender.loan_because: I believe that all of the little steps we can make are important. Also doing something small like this can and eventually will influence other people to act the same way.

lender.name: Jeanne
lender.loan_because: I want to see people succeed. I know what it is like to yearn for a better life and to get it. I am excited that I can help another person improve their quality of life.
lender.occupational_info: I make jewelry, do skin care and work in weddings.

lender.name: Thida
lender.loan_because: I am not rich, but I can help those that are in desperate need, it is an amazing feeling.

lender.name: Rob
lender.loan_because: It's the "little things in life" that matter most. Because I know this, I aim incessantly to make things "better" in "little ways" -- in my own life, and thereby hopefully in the lives of others. I may be "poor" in some ways, but I never cease to count my blessings. I have more than what I "need", and so wish to share the "excess" of what I have with those who have less yet strive and struggle mightily every single day to "improve" their own lives and the future prospects of their children. LIFE ain't "fair", and that's a fact. My intention is to "offset" this fact as best I am able on an "individual basis" via this type of (Kiva) "micro-lending" . . . which I think is a potentially "world-changing" innovation! I desire no thanks of any kind. 'Just "pass it on" to kith & kin -- and maybe the world will, eventually, become (a lot!) less "unfair".
lender.occupational_info: Frankly, I am grossly "under"-employed. And what I do is BORING!! Yet, my fundamental task is to provide "service" to folks just like me. Therefore, this thought uppermost in my mind, I daily strive to provide the best possible "service" that I can. My efforts in this regard are not noted by my "superiors", but they are ALWAYS appreciated by my Customers!. And doing well "by others" is exactly all that I wish to accomplish in this "job" that I presently hold. It "pays-the-bills" -- and often that is MORE than most folks can (even) hope for! Well, I'm doing "OK", and understand that MOST folks ain't. So, my aim is to "share", one-to-one, what I've been blessed to "receive" with those who have "less". I have "more", others have "less", I desire to share my "more" with those having "less". It's just that simple.

lender.name: Microeconomics Club
lender.loan_because: We care about our neighbors and believe everyone deserves a chance to have a better life.
lender.occupational_info: We are a group of children in the third, fourth and fifth grade. We are entrepreneurs/students that are interested in working for the common good.

lender.name: tom
lender.loan_because: I hope it will allow local economies to grow and the entrepreneurs to become succesfull and help achieve this goal.
lender.occupational_info: I use a computer to keep tabs on income and spending of a large school council.

lender.name: Linda
lender.loan_because: I believe the fastest way to raise a region out of poverty is to encourage and enable entrepreneurs to create a local, sustainable community.
lender.occupational_info: I help people and companies increase their profits by communicating their messages to clients and potential customers through the appropriate use of Social Networking, Social Media and Internet Marketing using the many free and low cost tools and techniques available.

lender.name: Kathryn
lender.loan_because: God has blessed me. I want to share God's blessing and love with others. "Share your food with the hungry, and give shelter to the homeless, Give clothes to those who need them, And do not hide from relatives who need your help." (Isaiah 58 v 7)
lender.occupational_info: I am a primary school teacher, teaching boys and girls age 7-11. I teach all subjects but my specialist subject is music.

lender.name: Britta B.
lender.loan_because: To share my good fortune.
lender.occupational_info: For my paying job I sit at a desk five days a week at a major global corporation. For my volunteer work, I help rescue retired racing Greyhounds from the race tracks.

lender.name: Steve
lender.loan_because: I like to help out others in need.

lender.name: Cary
lender.loan_because: The world has been good to me. I have a great life. I want to help others to be as fortunate as I have been.
lender.occupational_info: I work with computers in the energy industry.

lender.name: Joanne O
lender.loan_because: I want to give single/widowed women and mothers a chance at a better life!
lender.occupational_info: Christian Pastoral Counselor

lender.name: Linda
lender.loan_because: Everyone should be able to provide for themselves and thier families. If my $25.00 can give someone an opportunity to do that then I am glad to do it. I hope I will be able to do more.
lender.occupational_info: I work in a library in the midwest. Our town has a population of 8,000 and we have over 9,000 library patrons. I love working there. I over see the Kansas Room, local history and genealogy. I also prepare new books for the shelves. We have the greatest group of patrons in the world.

lender.name: NLSA
